description.narrative: More girls and boys, including the most marginalized benefit from increased national, sub-national and community capacity to access and complete preschool and basic education, and transition to further education, which contributes to Early Learning, Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equitable Access To Quality Education (Covid), Learning Outcomes, Operations Support To Programme Delivery. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: All children have improved access to quality inclusive education, from early learning to secondary education, particularly those who are most marginalised

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: More girls and boys, including the most marginalized benefit from increased national, sub-national and community capacity to access and complete preschool and basic education, and transition to further education

description.narrative: Quality learning opportunities supported with focus on early learning and transition into upper-secondary education. In Early Childhood Education, UNICEF in collaboration with the local authorities ensured access to early learning for children (girls and boys) from ethnically and linguistically diverse backgrounds. Closer to 1200 children years 4-6 from ethnic minorities benefited from multi-lingual education. In lower secondary education, an Early Warning System model developed for school drop-out prevention. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:16/12/2019
